data.text: @BillyNillesDUH You made some very valid points. But there were also times when you were just reaching.

@keo___pi_ You seems to be intentionally obscuring the point of what Drake is doing when he scolds women on how to be "good." And that's not something I have the time or energy to deal with. Sorry you think it was a trash article. Enjoy your day.

@BillyNillesDUH the biggest example you used, you agreed with him and your only response was, "oh, why not talk about men", you don’t even have a leg to stand on. why are you telling women what to do, billy?

@BillyNillesDUH yes, because everyone has their definition of “good”. it’s almost like people have different outlooks on good and bad and have this weird thing called opinions. and they even have different outlooks and perspectives.
@keo___pi_ How are they not Drake specific when everything I quoted is from a Drake song, allegedly written by Drake himself?

@BillyNillesDUH you used examples and did nothing to back them up. and your examples aren’t even drake specific. i’m trying to understand why you expected people to take the article seriously when it seems like you didn’t.

@BillyNillesDUH but not only that, but you use examples and do nothing to back them up. you quoted "emotionless", and then basically agreed with the sentiment. you quoted "that's how you feel" and tried to attack the fact that drake has an issue with someone who displays alcoholic tendencies.
@keo___pi_ Plenty of straight males sing about women without condescending to tell them how to be "good." w i l d.

@BillyNillesDUH nah, it’s not that men aren’t fond of it, it’s that it’s just bad. 

for example, this entire article seems to disregard the fact that drake is speaking from his perspective, so of course there is going to be a focus on women because drake is a straight male. w i l d.
